text: Why is TD-IDF called an Instance-based Model?

author: @karannchew2534
text: Notes for future revision.  TF-IDF = Term Frequency x Inversed Document Frequency  TF = Term Frequency = Prob of a word within a sentence  IDF = Inversed Document Frequency = Prob of a word among all sentences i.e. the whole text, BUT inversed  TF-IDF  = Prob of a word in a sentence x Prob of a word in a document but inversed  If a word is frequent within a sentence, TF-IDF is high. If a word is frequent within a document, TF-IDF is low.
